item.description:
The SoWa Open Market offers an ever-changing group of artisans at a hip location in Boston's South End. It's fast becoming THE place to shop for the work of the South End's well-known artist's community.

SOWA hosts a wide variety of vendors and artists who sell everything from hand-crafted accessories, original art, indie designer clothing or just a fresh loaf of bread. You'll also find painters, sculptors, photographers, clothing and jewelry designers, milliners, handbag designers, house wares, florists, bakers, local farmer's produce and much more!

It promises to be a unique photo-taking opportunity.

We'll meet in the morning when the market first opens and then find a place for lunch for those of you who want to stick around.

The location close to Rte 93 with free parking just up the street from the market at 500 Harrison Ave. It's also accessible via the T (Orange Line to the Mass Ave busline -- about 10 minutes from the station then a short walk down Harrison Ave.)

KEEP your fingers crossed for one of those glorious sunny fall days!

Hope to see you there... Dianne
item.how_to_find_us: Across the street from the Market in front of 519 Harrison Ave.
item.name: Sunday at the SOWA Market
